description_txt: stated on September 27, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Since 2000, when he entered politics, Jon Husted has been on the ballot six times for three different political offices."

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2010 in a Leadership Florida/Florida Press Association debate.:
quote_txt: Says Alex Sink's plans for governor include $12.5 billion in new spending.

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "You worked hard for your money and you paid your taxes when you earned it. Now, (Indiana Republican congressional candidate) Todd Young wants to tax it again when you spend it."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "Carly Fiorina, she's against banning assault weapons."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2010 in an election ad:
quote_txt: Tom Ganley has "two F's from the Better Business Bureau" and "over 160 complaints in just three years."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2010 in a news conference with reporters:
quote_txt: "Scientists have shown us (that) the greater possibilities, the real science movement, has been with adult stem cell research. It has not been with embryonic."

description_txt: stated on October 20, 2010 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says Bruce Starr broke the law by letting lobbyists wine and dine him in Maui.

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2010 in a chain e-mail.:
quote_txt: Says Texas voters are being asked to act this November on a proposed constitutional amendment affecting property taxes.

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2010 in a Leadership Florida/Florida Press Association debate:
quote_txt: Says Marco Rubio sold a home to a chiropractor who had been lobbying him on automobile insurance legislation and "once he sold the home, for $380,000 cash, the speaker's position on the issue changed."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Pat Toomey "still supports privatizing Social Security."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says Maryellen O’Shaughnessy "accepted campaign cash from indicted politician Jimmy Dimora."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2010 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: The Seattle Times called Patty Murray "a 'prolific sponsor of earmarks.' Patty even defended the 'Bridge to Nowhere.' "

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: As state treasurer, Alexi Giannoulias "lost $73 million in our kids’ college savings."

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2010 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "We refused to balance the budget on the backs of our children."

description_txt: stated on October 19, 2010 in a television ad:

description_txt: stated on October 4, 2010 in a mailer:

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in a debate:
quote_txt: Under the new health care law, "the first person (a) patient has to go to is a bureaucrat. That is called a panel."

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "Ted Strickland destroyed Ohio jobs when he busted the budget."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in a TV ad:

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Rand Paul wants "to end all federal faith-based initiatives, and even end the deduction for religious charities."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in a statement posted to his website:
quote_txt: On privatization of Social Security.

description_txt: stated on October 5, 2010 in a TV campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Said U.S. Rep. Jim Marshall, D-Macon, sent nearly $2 billion overseas to build wind turbines and create jobs, mostly in China

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2010 in an e-mail:

quote_txt: Says Christopher Little has "a history of working against environmental protection by defending the worst types of corporate polluters"
